intro: Dodonaea stenophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaf hop萧, is a shrub native to Australia. It belongs to the family Verbenaceae and is characterized by its narrow, leathery leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in sandy or rocky soils. It produces small, woody fruits that contain several seeds. Dodonaea stenophylla is often used in landscaping for its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
